q: to share the wealth with its unionized work forces now that they are solidly profitable. It's a harder problem than it seems, since both have become solid moneymakers in part because of worker concessions. It was absolutely owed that we treat our people properly, CEO Sergio Marchionne told analysts and reporters on a conference call, as reported by the Free Press. "The obligation to our people was much greater than the need to improve our bottom line profitability."

At Facebook, 26-year-old founder and CEO Mark Zuckerberg calls the shots in an entrepreneurial culture that has enticed dozens of engineers to leave Google Inc. to work for the social networking company. ," Eric Schmidt said in a prepared statement. "By clarifying our individual roles we'll create clearer responsibility and accountability at the top of the company." * Despite Michael Vick 's dark past, Mayor Tom Leppert Pro Tem Dwaine Caraway presented the Eagles quarterback with a key to the city of Dallas. However, Mayor Tom Leppert denies any approval of the gift. The action taken was not sanctioned by my office and was not an official ceremonial honor on behalf of the city of Dallas, he said. The mayor added that "official keys to the city" are presented by the mayor or an elected official designated by the mayor and are reserved for "an elected official of international status
